If $ n$ is a real number, then the simultaneous system\\
\\
$ nx + y = 1$\\
$ ny + z = 1$\\
$ x + nz = 1$\\
\\
has no solution if and only if $ n$ is equal to\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ -1 \qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ 0 \qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ 1 \qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ 0 \text{ or } 1 \qquad 
\textbf{(E)}\ \frac12$
